alert.note: Alert for Joshua Tree NP East; Joshua Tree NP West (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 17 at 1:17PM PDT by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY MORNING THROUGH MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...Portions of Arizona, including the following areas, Aguila Valley, Central La Paz, Gila Bend, Gila River Valley, Kofa, Parker Valley, Sonoran Desert Natl Monument, Southeast Yuma County, Tonopah Desert, West Pinal County and Yuma. Portions of California, including the following areas, Chiriaco Summit, Chuckwalla Mountains, Chuckwalla Valley, Imperial County Southeast, Imperial County Southwest, Imperial County West, Imperial Valley, Joshua Tree NP East, Joshua Tree NP West, Palo Verde Valley and Salton Sea. * WHEN...From Saturday morning through Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Area creeks and streams are running high and could flood with more heavy rain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A rich moisture plume will accompany tropical cyclone Hilary as it progresses north along the west coast of Mexico and into Southern California this weekend. This will lead to widespread heavy rainfall across Southern California and Southwestern Arizona through this weekend. A combination of rapid onset and slow response flooding is expected with high rain rates and rainfall totals. Rainfall totals will be highest in the mountains of Southern California, in upslope favored regions, and with banding. With rainfall amounts forecast around 2-4 inches across Southern California and Southwest AZ, and localized amounts up to 6+ inches, there is potential for considerable flooding across the region. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: Joshua Tree NP East; Joshua Tree NP West
